snippet: When the efforts to fix a faulty and spottily enforced noise ordinance became bogged down, the New Orleans City Council decided to try to fix what is perhaps the country’s pre-eminent 24-hour street party.
abstract: New Orleans is attempting to limit cacophony on Bourbon Street, largely tourist area in city's famed French Quarter district that boasts a 24-hour street party; move is part of city-wide effort to enforce spotty noise ordinances, but faces uphill battle amid conflicting interests of neighbors, musicians, nightlife employees and others.
lead_paragraph: When the efforts to fix a faulty and spottily enforced noise ordinance became bogged down, the New Orleans City Council decided to try to fix what is perhaps the country’s pre-eminent 24-hour street party.

headline.main: Debate on Bourbon St.: Should the Good Times Roll Less Loudly?
headline.print_headline: Debate on Bourbon St.: Should the Good Times Roll Less Loudly?
